summary: US-China tariff standstill may mean the "Magnificent Seven" trade does anything but stay in place . The US and China agreed on Monday to reduce "reciprocal" tariffs on goods from China to 10% from 125% . The Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF (MAGS) ripped 6% in premarket trading .  Traders use the Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF as a proxy for the Mag 7, as its top holdings are the seven stocks . China will cut its retaliatory tariffs on US goods to 10% from 125% . The Mag 7 trade was climbing back into top form after a challenging stretch this year .  Goldman Sachs data shows Mag 7 companies delivered 28% average earnings growth in the first quarter . The 493 other stocks in the S&P 500 delivered only 9% growth . Some pros continue to advise caution before going all in again on the Mag 7 .  The latest episode of "Opening Bid" will feature the biggest names in business and markets on Opening Bid . Watch the full episode on our video hub at 10 a.m. ET .
